title: Kedarnath
description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located in the Indian state of Uttarakhand.

title: Badrinath
description: A prominent pilgrimage site in Uttarakhand, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, known for its scenic beauty and spiritual significance.

title: Gangotri
description: The source of the Ganges River, a sacred place in Uttarakhand where pilgrims come to bathe in the holy river.

title: Yamunotri
description: The source of the Yamuna River, another important pilgrimage site in Uttarakhand, famous for its hot springs.

title: Kedarnath Temple
description: The ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located in the Kedarnath region, is an essential part of the Char Dham pilgrimage.

title: Badrinath Temple
description: A sacred temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, situated in the Badrinath region, known for its intricate carvings and religious significance.

title: Gangotri Temple
description: The temple dedicated to Goddess Ganga, located at the source of the Ganges River, attracting thousands of devotees every year.

title: Yamunotri Temple
description: The temple dedicated to Goddess Yamuna, located at the source of the Yamuna River, known for its sacred thermal springs.

title: Kedarnath Trek
description: A challenging trek that takes pilgrims through beautiful landscapes to reach the Kedarnath temple, surrounded by snow-capped peaks.

title: Badrinath Yatra
description: The pilgrimage journey to Badrinath, known for its spiritual significance and the scenic beauty of the surrounding mountains.

title: Gangotri Yatra
description: The pilgrimage to Gangotri, where devotees come to pay homage to Goddess Ganga and bathe in the holy river.

title: Yamunotri Yatra
description: The pilgrimage to Yamunotri, featuring a visit to the sacred temple and the thermal springs located at the source of the Yamuna River.
